required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world Data in Patients With Advanced Breast Cancer Treated With Abemaciclib
clinical_study.official_title: Real-world Clinical Outcome and Toxicity Data in Patients With Advanced Breast Cancer Treated With Abemaciclib Combined With Endocrine Therapy: the Experience of the Hellenic Cooperative Oncology Group

brief_summary.textblock: The present study will assess real-world clinical outcomes and adverse events from treatment with endocrine therapy combined with abemaciclib in patients with HR-positive, HER2-negative advanced breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through the completion of the study, for an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: the time from treatment initiation to either the first documented disease progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of treatment until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 96 months
secondary_outcome.description: the time from treatment initiation to patient death or last contact

arm_group.description: Patients with advanced breast cancer treated with abemaciclib in combination wih endocrine treatment

study_pop.textblock: Patients with histologically confirmed HR-positive, HER2-negative advanced breast cancer treated with abemaciclib in combination with endocrine therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed HR-positive, HER2-negative advanced breast cancer
- Treated at Hellenic Cooperative Oncology Group (HeCOG)-affiliated departments of oncology
- 18 years or older
- Any menopausal status
- Treatment with abemaciclib in combination with endocrine therapy
- Any endocrine therapy
- At least two months of treatment with abemaciclib
